message.content: The area of the original screen is $24 \times 16 = 384$ square inches. Increasing both dimensions by $20 \%$ is equivalent to increasing the length and width by $\frac{20}{100} = 0.2$ times their original values. Thus, the new dimensions are $1.2 \times 24 = 28.8$ inches and $1.2 \times 16 = 19.2$ inches. The area of the new screen is $28.8 \times 19.2 = 552.96$ square inches. So the area is increased by $\frac{552.96-384}{384} = \frac{168.96}{384} \approx \frac{169}{384}$. Converting this to percent gives $\frac{169}{384} \times 100\% \approx \boxed{44\%}$.
